vision.notes: Finches often have colourful plumage, suggesting well-developed color vision. Sex-based plumage differences, as seen in Euphonias, further support this.

audition.notes: Songbirds. The Yellow-throated Euphonia has a shrill song and can mimic other birds. Used historically to detect carbon monoxide in mines.

olfaction.notes: No information provided in the context. However, detection of gases in coal mines implies some olfactory capability.

taste.notes: Adapted for eating seeds and nuts. Also known to eat fruit, implying a sense of taste to determine ripeness.

touch.notes: Necessary for building domed nests and feeding hatchlings, indicating tactile sensitivity.
